title: Ambirus
author: Ambirus
content: Hello. I decided to write a few articles related to the topic of cryptocurrencies? Advise what forums and websites are there for publishing my articles on the topic of cryptocurrencies?Can I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMHello. I decided to write a few articles related to the topic of cryptocurrencies? Advise what forums and websites are there for publishing my articles on the topic of cryptocurrencies?Can I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?I've seen on bitcointalk here and there - especially on the services area - people wanting to write articles for websites, some even for free. So you have competition on that.So the first thing that comes into my mind is: if you don't necessarily want to monetize your articles, you can make your own blog or medium page, there are plenty of free options.And yes, you can put your articles or quote them here if you want to open a discussion on the matter. You can take a look on what Hydrogen does, for example (his topics list is here). The point is to put relevant text and indeed open a discussion, not just post links; and obviously don't spam. Also, if you quote, make sure you put the source, even if that one is also yours (so you avoid accusations of plagiarism).

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: On any platform, this forum or any others including forums, blog sites, media sites, you must have good CV and reputation in order to get jobs. Reputation has to be built with time and if you have good reputation, you will get more accepted articles and sometimes you will receive offers from employers.You can find jobs for content writinghttps://beincrypto.com/jobs/https://hyve.works/Cointelegraph, Coindesk and similar sites have open positions too but you must have good skills and past works to convince them to hire you.

comments.author: alik111
comments.body: To publish your own articles on cryptocurrencies you can easily use Bitcointalk, Cryptotalk and altscointalk forum. Then the best one will be this forum and you need to be a minimum junior member to post with photos or you can buy a copper membership to upload photos.

comments.author: jackg
comments.body: Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMCan I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?Yes, just make sure you provide a link to the original article as otherwise it might be considered plagiarism and get you banned.There are a lot of forums in the cryptospace and there are probably too many for people to come up with good suggestions for where you'll get the list traction. I can think reddit and bitcointalk might be useful places to start though if you don't want to search around too much.I'd recommend posting a decent amount of the article on the forum too as many are averse to clicking links but might do once they see a site with good reputation/reporting - I don't know how many actually go this way though it might be easier to get views by buying ads on faucets and similar sites once you can get ad revenue to yours (I think it takes a long time for these sorts of sites to be paid back in views and user activity).

comments.author: Fivestar4everMVP
comments.body: Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMCan I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?First, I don't know what everyone else feels, but I personally feel this thread does not belong to this board, here is for bitcoin related discussions only, this thread is best suited for Beginners and help board - though it's not in my power to decide, but the moderators. Secondly, to answer your question I quoted above, "Yes" you can actually write cryptocurrency articles on this forum, there is a special board for articles, and that is the press board, so feel free to write your cryptocurrency articles and post there.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: They're not specifically for bitcoin/crypto-related stuff, but Medium and Substack is still probably two of the best blogging sites. Medium gets you more organic traffic even if you don't post the articles on social media, while Substack is great if you want to release content like every week or so.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: jackg on August 30, 2022, 02:05:14 PMYes, just make sure you provide a link to the original article as otherwise it might be considered plagiarism and get you banned.If such an issue comes up, as it has a couple of times I noticed, it would be fixed up quickly enough with an appeal and proof that the original article was posted by the same user.Regardless, it's always ideal to reference the original source of the work.Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMAdvise what forums and websites are there for publishing my articles on the topic of cryptocurrencies?Except you work for one of the popular crypto websites, you can not post an article there. Your best option would be to run a personal blog or create an account on one of such websites.There are also such platforms on which one can get paid for posting articles related to cryptocurrencies.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: OP, what is the primary goal that you want to achieve by posting your articles publicly?Do you want to expand your audience and knowledge about a product, service, or company... or maybe you just want to have relevant references as a copywriter?I will add to the suggestion list from other members https://www.publish0x.com/ there you can post your article, and if you are good, maybe you can earn some money from your work. the site is quite popular with high traffic.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMCan I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?As others suggested, you can post in médium or other websites.But why don't you post them here? If they are really good and bitcoin focused, you can even monetize them here by joining signature campaigns. You can also interact with people who read your articles here, by replying comments. I think it is a good start.

comments.author: wtsimis
comments.body: Quote from: Ambirus on August 30, 2022, 09:31:39 AMHello. I decided to write a few articles related to the topic of cryptocurrencies? Advise what forums and websites are there for publishing my articles on the topic of cryptocurrencies?Can I also post my articles on the Bitcointalk forum?I was writing articles for a long time related to cryptocurrencies topic. I mainly publish my articles in publish0x, leofinance or hive. There are pretty few other micro-blog sites like read.cash and noise.cash. All these sites are focused on cryptocurrency articles. If you have a personal blog, you can also publish the same articles everywhere. I saw many bloggers publish the same articles on different platforms.Some examples: xuanling11( you can check out https://www.xuanling11.com/)johnwege ( you can check out https://www.publish0x.com/@johnwege)PVMihalache ( you can check out https://www.publish0x.com/@PVMihalache)You can see my post also here https://www.publish0x.com/saikots-blog/evaluating-tokenomics-xnxvzyv also here https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5396160.msg59973370#msg59973370Same articles I published on different platforms. But while things need to be cleared up. Before posting the same article on different sites, give the reference of the first published site (Reference is everything). You should maintain the same author personality on all platforms.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: I used to post on Steemit in the past, it is quite good but don't expect a lot of payment if that's what you're looking for. You don't really need to market your post here, but most of the time the traffic are just bots unless your content is really unique. Use it as your third or even fourth alternative if you need to post on more places.
